com.googlecode.catchexception.apis
Class CatchExceptionHamcrestMatchers

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.catchexception.apis.CatchExceptionHamcrestMatchers

public class CatchExceptionHamcrestMatchers
extends Object

Provides some Hamcrest matchers to match some exception properties.

EXAMPLE: 

// given an empty list
List myList = new ArrayList();

// when we try to get first element of the list
catchException(myList).get(1);

// then we expect an IndexOutOfBoundsException with message "Index: 1, Size: 0" 
assertThat(caughtException(),
  allOf(
    is(IndexOutOfBoundsException.class), 
    hasMessage("Index: 1, Size: 0"),
    hasNoCause()
  )
);

To combine the standard Hamcrest matchers, your custom matchers, these matchers, and other matcher collections (as JUnitMatchers) in a single class follow the instructions outlined in Sugar generation.

Hint: This class might use hamsandwich in the future but as long as hamsandwich is not in any public maven repository, this class will not use hamsandwich.

Author:
rwoo

Method Detail

hasMessage

public static <T extends Exception> org.hamcrest.Matcher<T> hasMessage(String expectedMessage)
EXAMPLE: 
assertThat(caughtException(), hasMessage("Index: 9, Size: 9"));

Type Parameters:
T - the exception subclass
Parameters:
expectedMessage - the expected exception message
Returns:
Returns a matcher that matches an exception if it has the given message.

hasMessageThat

public static <T extends Exception> org.hamcrest.Matcher<T> hasMessageThat(org.hamcrest.Matcher<String> stringMatcher)
EXAMPLES: 
assertThat(caughtException(), hasMessageThat(is("Index: 9, Size: 9")));
assertThat(caughtException(), hasMessageThat(containsString("Index: 9"))); // using JUnitMatchers
assertThat(caughtException(), hasMessageThat(containsPattern("Index: \\d+"))); // using Mockito's Find

Type Parameters:
T - the exception subclass
Parameters:
stringMatcher - a string matcher
Returns:
Returns a matcher that matches an exception if the given string matcher matches the exception message.

hasNoCause

public static <T extends Exception> org.hamcrest.Matcher<T> hasNoCause()
EXAMPLE: 
assertThat(caughtException(), hasNoCause());

Type Parameters:
T - the exception subclass
Returns:
Returns a matcher that matches the exception if it does not have a cause.
